Description: Fragment from lower part of large pottery vessel; interior glazed; exterior, front part of goat grazing to right, between bands; large rising triangle as filling ornament
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Very likely to be from the same vessel as British Museum 1886,0401.1270. .
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 219, no. 67)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 111, pl. XXXIV, no. 321.11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.02)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4658 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
